text.title: Install a Virtual Machine on Your Computer
text.head: Install a Virtual Machine on Your Computer
Steps
Create Space on Computer

list.item:
Make enough space. If you don't have enough storage to install a VM machine, consider uninstalling any programs that aren't currently being used.
Having enough space on your laptop or pc will make visualBox run smoothly without any lag.

Restart the computer.
After uninstalling unused apps restart your computer.

text.head: Downloading Virtual Machine Apk

list.item:
Open a web browser and go to your selected virtual machine providers website.
Search for download links.

Before installing link ensure that the website has a secure icon on the web browser.
Ensure that a website is secure before installing anything unto your computer
Installing applications from an unsecured website might make your laptop vulnerable for hacks or trojan virus.

Follow the instructions. If the web page is a secure process to the download link and accepts any additional instructions that come up.
If web pages are secure click on the download link and at the bottom of your laptop screen, you will see the file downloading.
Never install a file from an unsecured website, because it could make your computer vulnerable for hacks and virus

text.head: Installing a Virtual Machine

list.item:
Launch the installer. After the download completes, start the installer. The installer will be located in the location specified when it was downloaded.
On your web browser search for downloads and you will be able to see your file.

After launching the installer, setup procedures will appear
keep clicking next on the installer.

Accept Network Interfaces.
Accept any form of network prompt that pops up.

Create icons. Be sure to create a desktop icon and start menu icon for easy access to the virtual machine.
Allows you to easily access the applications on your home screen.

Accept any other installation and Click Finish.
Depending on your computer, you might get extra options, but after that click Finish.

Restart.
Restarting your computer will make all the changes you have made to be applied quickly

text.head: Running an Operating System on a Visual Machine

list.item:
Download your Desired Operating system ISO File.
Different operating systems that could be used would be Windows,macOS, Mint, chrome os, ubuntu, arch Linux, etc.

Once Download is complete, Launch VirtualBox.
Once you have downloaded your desired operating system, Launch VirtualBox or any other virtual machine that you have chosen to run your OS on.
Once VisualBox is launched click on New.
Provide a name for the Operating system.
Choose Operating system space.
Select VirtualDisk Type.

Attach OS File to visualBox.
Click on settings and choose storage.
On Storage attach your operating system file.
Select ubuntu and Click Start.

text.head: Tips

list.item: Make sure your operating system can support the programs that you intend to install
Ensure that you have enough space on your laptop or pc to avoid storage errors while installing the virtual machine and other components

text.head: Things you'll Need

list.item: Computer running Windows 7, 8, or 10
Internet Connection
Enough Storage Space
Laptop or PC
